There are $n$ workers in a company, each with a unique ID from 1 to $n$. One worker is the chief, with ID $s$. Every worker except the chief has exactly one immediate superior.

Each worker was asked to report the number of superiors they have (including their immediate superior).  

You are given a list of $n$ numbers, where the $i$-th number represents the number of superiors reported by the worker with ID $i$.

Find the minimum number of workers who could have made a mistake in their report.

There are workers in a company, one of whom is the leader. Each worker except the leader reports to exactly one other worker.  Each worker was asked to count how many people they report to (including themselves).  Find the fewest number of workers who could have counted incorrectly.
